list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Update and reorganize .gitignore files
Replaced `front-manager/.gitignore` with a centralized and comprehensive root-level `.gitignore`. This ensures better consistency, eliminates redundancies, and provides improved coverage for Node.js, environment files, IDE settings, build artifacts, and OS-specific files.

task.summary:
Initialize NestJS backend application structure
Set up a basic NestJS application with key components including the AppModule, controller, and service. Added configuration files, scripts, and testing setup for unit and e2e tests. Included a `.gitignore` and package management files to define project dependencies.

Integrate PostgreSQL and create project schema.
Added PostgreSQL connection using TypeORM with async configuration and .env support. Implemented initial database schema with tables for projects, phases, activities, milestones, documents, employees, and associated relations. Verified connection success with a test script. Updated `.gitignore` and dependencies in `package.json`.

Add core modules for user, project, role, and document management
Introduce key modules such as Users, Projects, Roles, and Documents with corresponding entities, DTOs, controllers, and services to handle CRUD operations. Additionally, implemented role-based access control (RBAC) using decorators, guards, and permissions handling, as well as initialized test data script for PostgreSQL.

Remove .idea/.gitignore from the repository
The .gitignore file under .idea is deleted to ensure irrelevant IDE-specific files are not tracked or mismanaged. This supports keeping the repository cleaner and more uniform across different development environments.

Create SQL script for database initialization
Add a new SQL script to initialize the database structure.

Remove compiled files and build artifacts from repository
Deleted compiled JavaScript files, type declaration files, and build-related artifacts from the dist directory. Updated the repository to no longer track build outputs and configuration fragments to ensure a cleaner codebase and reduce unnecessary repository clutter."

Refactor remove method to add explicit type annotation.
Added explicit type annotation for the 'activity' variable in the remove method to improve code clarity and type safety. This ensures better readability and adherence to TypeScript best practices.

Remove 'front-manager/' from .gitignore
The 'front-manager/' directory is no longer ignored, likely to track its changes in version control. This update ensures that relevant files within the directory are included in future commits.

Remove `.gitignore` and add IntelliJ IDE configuration files
The `.gitignore` file was deleted, potentially exposing previously ignored files. Additionally, IntelliJ-specific configuration files and database connection settings for PostgreSQL were introduced, indicating the setup of IntelliJ project and database integration.

Remove `.gitignore` and adjust IntelliJ config files
Deleted the `.gitignore` file, which may expose previously ignored files. Updated IntelliJ configuration with VCS settings and database integration for PostgreSQL. Added changes related to NestJS project setup and backend file inclusion.

Add project configurations and dependencies for back-manager
Initialized the back-manager project by adding required configuration files such as `tsconfig.json` and `nest-cli.json`, as well as the `package-lock.json` with necessary dependencies. These additions prepare the project structure for development with NestJS and TypeScript.

Add role, user, auth, and permissions modules with JWT
Introduces modules for user, role, and authentication, alongside a permissions system with role-based access control (RBAC). Implements JWT-based authentication using strategies, guards, and decorators to restrict and manage access.

Add foundational modules for project management functionality
Introduced core modules for projects, phases, activities, milestones, and documents in the backend. Each module includes entity definitions, DTOs for data validation, services, and controllers to handle basic CRUD operations. These changes establish the groundwork for managing project-related data and relationships.

Add return type annotation to role.controller findAll method
Updated the findAll method in role.controller to explicitly declare a Promise<any> return type. This enhances code clarity and type safety.

Add a comprehensive README for ProjectManager
Provides detailed project information, including description, technologies, structure, and setup instructions. This README serves as a foundational documentation for developers and users alike.

Add a comprehensive README for ProjectManager
Provides detailed project information, including description, technologies, structure, and setup instructions. This README serves as a foundational documentation for developers and users alike.

Update and reorganize .gitignore files
Replaced `front-manager/.gitignore` with a centralized and comprehensive root-level `.gitignore`. This ensures better consistency, eliminates redundancies, and provides improved coverage for Node.js, environment files, IDE settings, build artifacts, and OS-specific files.

MESSAGE.value:
Initialize NestJS backend application structure
Set up a basic NestJS application with key components including the AppModule, controller, and service. Added configuration files, scripts, and testing setup for unit and e2e tests. Included a `.gitignore` and package management files to define project dependencies.

Configure database integration and environment variables
Integrated PostgreSQL using TypeORM and added dynamic environment configuration support with `.env` files. Included connection testing script and updated dependencies to support database operations. Updated `.gitignore` to exclude sensitive environment files.

Integrate PostgreSQL and create project schema.
Added PostgreSQL connection using TypeORM with async configuration and .env support. Implemented initial database schema with tables for projects, phases, activities, milestones, documents, employees, and associated relations. Verified connection success with a test script. Updated `.gitignore` and dependencies in `package.json`.

Add core modules for user, project, role, and document management
Introduce key modules such as Users, Projects, Roles, and Documents with corresponding entities, DTOs, controllers, and services to handle CRUD operations. Additionally, implemented role-based access control (RBAC) using decorators, guards, and permissions handling, as well as initialized test data script for PostgreSQL.

Remove generated files, update type annotations, and add SQL script
This commit removes all unnecessary generated files and directories, such as build outputs and IDE configurations, improving repository cleanliness. It updates type annotations in `activities.service.ts` for better type safety. Additionally, a new `CreateDatabase.sql` script is added to assist with database setup.

Remove .idea/.gitignore from the repository
The .gitignore file under .idea is deleted to ensure irrelevant IDE-specific files are not tracked or mismanaged. This supports keeping the repository cleaner and more uniform across different development environments.

Create SQL script for database initialization
Add a new SQL script to initialize the database structure.

Remove compiled files and build artifacts from repository
Deleted compiled JavaScript files, type declaration files, and build-related artifacts from the dist directory. Updated the repository to no longer track build outputs and configuration fragments to ensure a cleaner codebase and reduce unnecessary repository clutter."

Refactor remove method to add explicit type annotation.
Added explicit type annotation for the 'activity' variable in the remove method to improve code clarity and type safety. This ensures better readability and adherence to TypeScript best practices.

Remove 'front-manager/' from .gitignore
The 'front-manager/' directory is no longer ignored, likely to track its changes in version control. This update ensures that relevant files within the directory are included in future commits.

Remove `.gitignore` and add IntelliJ IDE configuration files
The `.gitignore` file was deleted, potentially exposing previously ignored files. Additionally, IntelliJ-specific configuration files and database connection settings for PostgreSQL were introduced, indicating the setup of IntelliJ project and database integration.

Add authentication, user, roles, and project management modules
Implemented modules for managing authentication, users, roles, and projects in a NestJS backend. This includes guards, strategies, controllers, services, DTOs, and entities to handle auth flow, CRUD operations, role-based access control, and project management. Also added database integration and configuration files for PostgreSQL.

Remove `.gitignore` and adjust IntelliJ config files
Deleted the `.gitignore` file, which may expose previously ignored files. Updated IntelliJ configuration with VCS settings and database integration for PostgreSQL. Added changes related to NestJS project setup and backend file inclusion.

Add authentication, user, role, project, and phase modules
Introduce modules for authentication, user management, roles, projects, and phases in the back-end system. Each module includes controllers, services, entities, DTOs, and repositories to handle associated features and functionality. Prepared the app to manage project-related workflows with secure authentication and role-based access control.

Add project configurations and dependencies for back-manager
Initialized the back-manager project by adding required configuration files such as `tsconfig.json` and `nest-cli.json`, as well as the `package-lock.json` with necessary dependencies. These additions prepare the project structure for development with NestJS and TypeScript.

Add core modules for user management, activities, and milestones
Implemented modules for user, role, activities, milestones, phases, and permissions. These include their respective DTOs, entities, services, controllers, and relations. Also added authentication and authorization mechanisms using guards.

Add role-based access control and project management modules
Introduced a role-based access control system using custom guards, decorators, and JWT authentication to manage permissions for endpoints. Added user, role, and project management modules with full CRUD functionality and validation. This enhances the backend with secure access control and modular resource management.

Add role, user, auth, and permissions modules with JWT
Introduces modules for user, role, and authentication, alongside a permissions system with role-based access control (RBAC). Implements JWT-based authentication using strategies, guards, and decorators to restrict and manage access.

Add foundational modules for project management functionality
Introduced core modules for projects, phases, activities, milestones, and documents in the backend. Each module includes entity definitions, DTOs for data validation, services, and controllers to handle basic CRUD operations. These changes establish the groundwork for managing project-related data and relationships.

Add return type annotation to role.controller findAll method
Updated the findAll method in role.controller to explicitly declare a Promise<any> return type. This enhances code clarity and type safety.

Add a comprehensive README for ProjectManager
Provides detailed project information, including description, technologies, structure, and setup instructions. This README serves as a foundational documentation for developers and users alike.

Update and reorganize .gitignore files
Replaced `front-manager/.gitignore` with a centralized and comprehensive root-level `.gitignore`. This ensures better consistency, eliminates redundancies, and provides improved coverage for Node.js, environment files, IDE settings, build artifacts, and OS-specific files.
